abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Additional Financing for
            the Community-Based Rural Development Project for Ghana were
            as follows: outcomes were satisfactory; risk to development
            outcome was low or negligible; Bank performance was
            satisfactory and borrower performance was also satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned includes: effective communication is
            the key to promoting development outcomes. Inject awareness
            of Natural resource management (NRM) at the community level
            by having natural resource department in the District
            Assembly's (DAs). Effective relationships among
            development partners and good donor collaboration and
            harmonization are paramount to the successful implementation
            of a decentralized project. Inexperience among rural banks
            and project staff with the lending promoted by the project,
            as well as the lack of business skills among clients, posed
            challenges for implementing component three. Decentralizing
            project management functions up to the zone and regional
            levels was very instrumental in ensuring smooth
            implementation of the project.
